title: interface{}(intXX) != literal int
body:
What does 'go version' print?
go version go1.2 linux/amd64

What steps reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.

1. http://play.golang.org/p/sFXC5peenp

What happened?
an interface{}(int64(13)) does not equal a literal value of 13.  Similarly, a variable
with an interface{} type fails comparisons.  It's necessary to explicitly compare to
type int64(13).

What should have happened instead?
int64, int32, and int are normally all comparable.  They still should be even if they
are wrapped in interface{}
